TopicDetails.description:
Scope:

Objective: Operating grants can be awarded to non-governmental, non-profit-making, independent of industry, commercial and business or other conflicting interests to improve consumers' education, information and awareness. Only European organisations mandated to represent the interests of consumers at Union level by organisations in at least half of the Member States are eligible for funding.

The purpose of this call is twofold:

  1. To conclude a Framework partnership agreements (FPA) for duration of maximum four years - covering the operating years 2015, 2016,2017 and 2018 in order to establish long term cooperation (partnership) between the contracting authority and the selected partner.
  2. To sign specific grant agreements (SGA) with the selected organisation in order to co-finance the functioning of their organisation for 2015 (1 January 2015 to 31 December 2015).

Applicant must submit an application for a Framework Partnership Agreement (FPA) for 2015-2018 and a Specific Grant Agreement (SGA) for 2015 at the same time. The successful applicants will then sign a FPA for a duration of four years (2015 to 2018). The FPA will include a multi-annual work programme for the period 2015-2018. Signing an FPA does not guarantee annual co-funding. Only the SGA proposals of the successful FPA proposals will be evaluated. The highest ranking SGA proposal will be awarded funding for the functioning of their organisation for 2015. This SGA invitation/evaluation process will be repeated for the years 2016, 2017 and 2018.

Scope: The primary objectives and activities of the applicant organisation should promote and protect both, health and safety as well as economic and legal interests of consumers in the European Union.

Type of action: Framework Partnership Agreement & Specific Grant Agreement (CONS-FPA / CONS-SGA-OG)

Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application.
 

  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: Described in section 6 of the Call document.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: Described in sections 5 and 6 of the Call document
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1 Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: Described in sections 8 and 9 of the Call document.

    3.2 For submission and evaluation process:  Guide for applicants 2014 - operating grants Framework Partnership Agreements (FPA) and Specific Grant Agreements (SGA)
     
  4. Proposal page limits and layout: Proposal for the framework partnership agreement is limited to 60 pages and the one for the specific grant agreement to 100 pages. 
     
  5. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement: Described in section 3 of the Call document.
     
  6. Provisions and proposal templates under this topic:
    Model Grant Agreement
    Standard proposal template
     
  7. Additional provisions:
    Please perform a financial viability self-check, using the PP tool of the financial viability self-check.
     
  8. Additional documents:
    Consumer Programme Decision
    Annual work programme 2014
    Annex to the annual work programme 2014
    EU Financial regulation

callDetailsJSONItem.additionalInfo: The present call for proposals aims at providing financial contributions (operating grant) to the functioning of a Union-level consumer organisation to improve consumers' education, information and awareness. This operating grant will cover part of the normal operating expenses of a non-governmental, non-profit-making, independent of industry, commercial and business or other conflicting interests, and have as their primary objectives and activities the promotion and protection of the health, safety, economic and legal interests of consumers in the Union.
